result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing 06-28-22 by SARAH SCHRAMKA.

Defendant Sherry Denise Redmon in court, appear by video with attorney Amanda Poznanski, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Schlax.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Poznanski contacted the court regarding the next date of 7/7/2022 at 8:30am, she is unavailable. Next date will be 6/28/2022 at 8:30am for a preliminary hearing. Parties are notified of the change.

Defendant Sherry Denise Redmon in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Poznanski to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Felix D.

Defendant Sherry Denise Redmon in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed.  Defendant Sherry Denise Redmon in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sherry Denise Redmon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
